CollectionCitations.Title: MUSTARD-UMLS Level 2 Retrieval Diagnostics Miscellaneous V1

EntryTitle: MUSTARD-UMLS Level 2 Retrieval Diagnostics Miscellaneous V1 (MUSUMLSL2DGM) at GES DISC

PublicationReferences.Author: Livesey, N. J., W. G. Read, L. Froidevaux, J. W. Waters, M. L. Santee, H. C. Pumphrey, D. L. Wu, Z. Shippony, and R. F. Jarnot
PublicationReferences.Title: The UARS Microwave Limb Sounder version 5 data set: Theory, characterization, and validation

RelatedUrls.Description: Access the dataset landing page from the GES DISC website.

The project web site at JPL.

Abstract:
The MUSTARD-UMLS Level 2 Retrieval Diagnostics Miscellaneous product (MUSUMLSL2DGM) contains the diagnostic quantities on a miscellaneous grid from the Microwave Limb Sounder instrument flown on the Upper Atmosphere Research Satellite (UMLS). These data include items such as tangent pressure, chi-square describing various fits to the measured radiances, number of radiances used in variious retrieval phases, etc. This product was created from the UARS MLS Level 3AT data for the NASA MEaSUREs project "Mesospheric and Upper Stratospheric Temperature and Related Datasets" or MUSTARD.

The UMLS instrument measured the microwave spectral region at frequencies of 63, 183 and 205 GHz. Limb measurements were made perpendicular to the satellite orbit track in the altitude range between 10 and 85 km with about 2.5 km resolution. Data were collected from latitude 34S to 80N and from 80S to 34N, alternating each satellite yaw cycle of about 36 days.

These data are archived as netCDF v4 files.
